responses: Blitz's EMP rocket is a slow-moving guided missile that jams nearby electronics. Best used to disrupt campers or to push a choke point. Pro tip: manual detonation can catch enemies off guard.
The EMP rocket from Blitz is great for area denial. Pop it into a crowded cap zone and watch the chaos—no electronics, no repairs.
Blitz counters hard campers. If a TD is dug in, send an EMP their way. The jam effect is longer than you think.
follow_up: Want to know which agents pair well with Blitz?
follow_up_affirmative: Blitz pairs incredibly well with Hound. The EMP jam makes enemies sit still, and Hound's mark turns them into easy kills. Also strong with Raketa—jam them, then let Raketa clean up with shotgun.
Try Blitz + Ember. Trophy turret protects your flank while you push, and the EMP clears enemy gadgets. It's a nasty combo on urban maps.
Blitz and Chopper is underrated. EMP stops them from running, bomber dazes them. They can't fight back at all.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Just ask if you change your mind about Blitz pairings.
Got it. Blitz is solid even solo—the EMP rocket doesn't need backup to be effective.
Fair enough. Blitz mains are lone wolves anyway.

responses: Anansi calls in an AC-130H Spectre. The 40mm is for soft targets, but the 105mm can delete heavily armored tanks. Save the 105 for the big boys.
Gunship support is all about timing. Don't pop Anansi during a brawl—pull back, spot, and let the 105s do the work.
Anansi's AC-130 has two firing modes. Use 40mm to strip tracks, 105mm for deletion. You get about 8 seconds of loiter—make it count.
follow_up: Need help with Anansi's positioning?
follow_up_affirmative: Position Anansi on elevated ridges with clear sightlines, but never on the front line. You want to be far enough to use the gunship safely, close enough to react. The construction site on Sunstroke? Perfect. The carrier deck on Aircraft Carrier? Death wish.
Always have an escape route. Anansi is squishy when caught out. Use hard cover, preaim your retreat, and never pop gunship when you're already spotted.
Late game, play aggressive. Your gunship is less valuable than your own cannon at close range. Don't hide when it's 3v3.
follow_up_negative: Copy that. You've got the positioning down.
No worries. Anansi clicks with some players naturally.
Alright. Just remember: high ground, hard cover, don't get flanked.

responses: Ember drops a Trophy turret that intercepts projectiles. Pair her with brawlers like the M60A3E2 to create an unstoppable push. She also gets a speed boost when rushing allies.
Trophy turrets eat ATGMs for breakfast. Drop one behind a corner and peek with confidence.
Ember's speed boost triggers when an ally is low. Don't just save it—use it to rotate or escape.
follow_up: Ember works great on maps with tight corridors. Want map tips?
follow_up_affirmative: Scarred City is Ember's playground. Drop Trophy turrets at apartment entrances and watch enemies waste their cooldowns. Sunstroke's construction site? Same deal—choke points everywhere.
On Aircraft Carrier, hold the interior corridors. Trophy turret blocks the only sightlines and your speed boost helps you retreat when the barge moves.

Avoid open maps like Nexus Dam. Ember thrives on confined spaces where enemies can't bypass your turret. If you're forced into open ground, use Trophy reactively—pop it when you hear missile lock, not preemptively.
follow_up_negative: All good. You know your maps.
Fair enough. Ember doesn't need a map guide, she IS the map guide.
Got it. Stick to tight streets and you'll be fine.

responses: Kent locks targets in his cone and calls ballistic strikes. His 'cursed luck' isn't just flavor—time your activation when enemies are clustered for multi-kills.
Kent's strike has a delay. Lead your targets, or use it to zone them out of an area.
Cursed luck means sometimes you miss. Don't tilt—the next one will hit.
follow_up: Kent is a strong counter to slow, armored brawlers. Interested?
follow_up_affirmative: Kent absolutely shuts down M60A3E2 pushes. They can't outrun the strike, and their armor means nothing to ballistic damage. Wait for them to commit to a brawl, then drop the hammer.
E-100 mains hate this one trick. Kent's strike ignores frontal armor completely. If you see a heavy pushing a corridor, activate and watch them panic.
Even against mediums, Kent's strike forces them out of position. Use it to clear ridges and cap circles, not just for kills.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Kent's still strong against everyone, just not specialized.
Fair. Brawlers aren't your problem right now.
Copy that. He's versatile anyway.

responses: Hound reveals critical modules. This extends the mark duration. Great for coordinating with high-alpha DPM tanks. If you see a weak spot lit up, take the shot.
Hound's mark persists through walls. If you see red, shoot. Even if you can't pen, you'll track them.
Pro tip: Hound marks ammo racks more often than you'd think. Always take that shot.
follow_up: Hound + Raketa is a nasty combo. Want the loadout?
follow_up_affirmative: Run Hound with Optics, IA, and CVS. You're the spotter first, killer second. For Raketa, go Vents, Turbo, and Rammer. You need speed to close the gap and DPM to finish what Hound marks. Play Hound safe, spot from bushes, let Raketa clean up. It's a one-two punch that wins games.

Alternate loadout: Hound takes Bond Optics and Binocs for max view range. Raketa runs full survivability—Hardening, Turbo, Repair Kit. The goal isn't to trade, it's to mark, heal, execute. You'll outlast everyone.
If you're running this duo in clan wars, Hound should prioritize marking enemy callers. Raketa, your job is to make them regret peeking.
follow_up_negative: No worries. Hound is strong with anyone who can shoot straight.
Fair. The combo isn't for everyone.
Got it. Hound works fine solo—just mark and pray your randoms shoot the red.

responses: Reaper executes any tank below 420 HP. His ability loads a clip of high-crit shells. Execute resets the clip. Time your push for the cleanup phase.
Reaper snowballs hard. One execute refills your magazine. If you see red, go for it.
Don't waste Reaper's execute on full-health targets. Wait for the low-hanging fruit.
follow_up: Reaper struggles against spaced armor. Need counter advice?
follow_up_affirmative: Spaced armor eats Reaper's crits for breakfast. Flank, or wait for them to angle poorly. Better yet, let your team soften them up and execute through the roof hatch—spaced armor doesn't cover cupolas.
Run calibrated shells. The penetration boost helps you punch through side skirts and track guards. It's worth the DPM loss against heavy armored targets.
If you're stuck fighting a spaced armor monster, track them first. Once they burn repair, push around and hit their flat sides. Reaper is an assassin, not a brawler. Don't fight fair.
follow_up_negative: Got it. You've faced spaced armor before.
Fair enough. Just aim for cupolas if you have to.
No problem. Spaced armor isn't everywhere.

responses: Raketa heals and gets tokens on kills. Activate his ability for a rapid-fire shotgun. He excels in close quarters. Don't let his jokes fool you—he's deadly.
Raketa's scrap tokens stack. The more you kill, the tankier you get. Don't be afraid to YOLO late game.
Shotgun mode shreds tracks. Use it to permatrack heavies while your team flanks.
follow_up: Raketa loves urban maps. Want map recommendations?
follow_up_affirmative: Scarred City is Raketa's #1 map. Every corner is a kill zone, apartments give you cover, and the cap zones are close quarters. Run Turbo and Hardening and become the apartment gremlin.
Sunstroke's construction site is also prime real estate. Pop in and out of the rubble, use shotgun mode to strip tracks, and let your team clean up. Just don't get caught in the open center.
Aircraft Carrier's interior corridors and the barge itself are Raketa territory. Hide behind the island structures, ambush anyone pushing the flank. You're not a frontliner—you're the cleanup crew.
follow_up_negative: No worries. You know where to take him.
Fair. Raketa is good enough to make any map urban.
Got it. Just avoid open fields and you're golden.

responses: Chopper calls in a bomber that dazes enemies. Use it to reset fights or stall caps. He's a bear of a man with a heart of gold... and a mean right hook.
The daze effect reduces enemy accuracy and movement speed. Pop it right before a push.
Chopper's strike has a huge radius. Don't just aim at tanks—aim at cap circles.
follow_up: Chopper pairs well with brawlers. Want a team comp?
follow_up_affirmative: Chopper + Ember + M60A3E2 is the holy trinity of brawl comps. Ember drops Trophy, Chopper dazes, M60 pushes in and absorbs everything. Run it on Scarred City for free wins.
For a more aggressive comp, try Chopper + Raketa + Hound. Chopper opens with daze, Hound marks the priority target, Raketa cleans up with shotgun. It's messy but effective.
Chopper also works with Anansi. Daze holds them still, gunship deletes them. Just need someone to spot—pair with a light tank or run it on a map with predictable traffic.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Chopper is strong in any comp.
Fair. He doesn't need synergy to be effective.
Got it. Sometimes you just need a big dumb bomber.

responses: Aircraft Carrier has a moving barge and multiple flank routes. Control the high ground on the carrier itself for vision advantage.
The barge moves early game. Use it to surprise enemies crossing mid.
Don't fight on the carrier deck without cover. TDs will punish you.
follow_up: Want the best light tank route on Aircraft Carrier?
follow_up_affirmative: Run the west flank, hug the island hard cover, and pop up near the barge docking area. You can spot the entire enemy push without exposing yourself. Don't go onto the carrier deck—that's a death sentence. Use the waterline rocks as hard cover and ping enemies for your TDs.

Alternative route: take the barge at match start. Ride it across, drop into the east side bushes, and passive spot the enemy spawn crossing. You'll die if you shoot, so stay dark. It's high risk, but the early game intel wins matches.
If you're in a light with good camo, go mid but don't stop. Spot, retreat, relocate. Never sit still. Aircraft Carrier is all about unpredictable pings.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Light tank routes aren't for everyone.
Fair. You probably play heavies anyway.
Got it. Just remember: the barge is a trap if you don't know when to get off.

responses: Nexus Dam offers vertical gameplay. Use the dam ridges to hull-down. Watch the side tunnels for flanks.
The tunnels are risky but rewarding. Bring a fast tank if you're going through.
Hull-down heavies dominate the central ridge. Don't push into them without support.
follow_up: Nexus Dam has a hidden flank route. Want to know it?
follow_up_affirmative: There's a water-level path on the east side that most players ignore. It's not on the minimap—you have to drive along the shoreline behind the destroyed buildings. It leads directly to the enemy backline, but there's zero cover. Only take it with a fast medium or light, and only when you know their TDs are busy. Pop out, dump your clip, and retreat. You won't survive if you linger.
The devs added this route in the last update and never documented it. Classic Sinewave move. Use it before they patch it out.
Quick tip: if you take this flank, bring a turbo and smoke. You need speed to survive the crossing.
follow_up_negative: No worries. It's better as a surprise anyway.
Fair. Knowing it exists might be enough.
Got it. Secret routes are overrated.

responses: Scarred City supports Conquest and Plant & Defuse. The kite formation base layout favors mobile tanks. Don't get bogged down in the main street.
Control the apartments. High-ground vision wins games here.
Scarred City is all about crossfires. Set up on one side, let the enemy push into your team.
follow_up: Want the best TD position on Scarred City?
follow_up_affirmative: Set up in the south apartments, second floor, window facing the cap zone. You've got hard cover, a sightline on the main push, and a quick escape down the stairs. Don't sit in the back bushes—that's how you get counter-batted. Scarred City rewards aggressive TD play.
Alternative spot: the rubble pile near the north cap. You're exposed but you can punish anyone peeking the crossing. Bring a teammate to spot and be ready to relocate after 2 shots.
Pro TD move: start at the apartments, take your shots, then move to the rubble. Never let them predict where you are. Scarred City is all about repositioning.
follow_up_negative: No problem. You know your sightlines.
Fair. TDs are about intuition more than positions.
Got it. Just don't sit in the same bush all game.

responses: Sunstroke is a close-quarters desert map. Use the construction site to break line of sight. Light tanks excel here.
The center ruins are a death trap. Spot from the edges, don't drive through.
Sunstroke rewards aggressive flanks. Take the east route with a medium and catch them off guard.
follow_up: Need a Sunstroke light tank spotting guide?
follow_up_affirmative: Sunstroke light tank 101: never go center. The ruins look tempting but every TD on the enemy team is already aimed at the gaps. Run the east ridge, use the sand dunes as natural defilade, and pop up only to spot. Your job isn't to do damage—it's to show red dots and not die.

If you're in a more aggressive light, take the construction site flank. Weave between the pillars, spot the heavy push, and fall back before they react. You're not a brawler, you're a harassment drone.
Late game, when the map opens up, you can push harder. But early? Stay alive, spot, and let your TDs earn their keep. Sunstroke punishes dead lights.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Light tanks aren't for everyone.
Fair. Sunstroke is brutal for spotting.
Got it. Sometimes you just want to brawl.

responses: Matcha? You mean the community legend? Word on the street is he's mentally stable now. Mostly. Don't mention the barcode.
Matcha once 1v5'd on a livestream. We don't talk about it.
Ice, grill, and a dream. That's the Matcha special.
follow_up: Want to know the story behind the barcode?
follow_up_affirmative: Okay, you asked for it. Matcha streamed for 14 hours straight during the 2024 charity marathon. By hour 12, he was scanning energy drink barcodes on stream, claiming they were 'tank weak spots.' Someone clipped it, it went viral, and now the barcode is his whole identity. He's embraced it, but he still gets embarrassed when you bring it up.
The barcode thing started as a meme, but Matcha actually won a tournament using the 'barcode technique.' Nobody knows if it's real or just the best troll in HEAT history.
Legend says if you scan the barcode on a can of Monster, Matcha appears in your next match. Not confirmed. Not denied.
follow_up_negative: Probably for the best. Some mysteries should stay mysteries.
Fair. The barcode lore is... a lot.
Got it. Matcha appreciates your restraint.

responses: SINEWAVE hasn't pushed an update in 3 hours. We're starting to get worried. Someone check on him.
Dev update? Last we heard, Sinewave was refactoring the CSS again.
Sinewave is probably fine. Probably. The repo hasn't caught fire yet.
follow_up: Want to know what the dev team is currently working on?
follow_up_affirmative: Sinewave is deep in the tank overhaul. New armor models, reworked weak spots, and a complete physics pass. He's been refactoring the same JSON file for a week. Someone send coffee.
The map team is prototyping a night version of Scarred City. Thermal optics might become a real mechanic. No ETA, obviously.
Also, we're finally getting a proper match history API. It's been on the roadmap since 2023. It's real this time. We swear.
Between us? The dev team is also working on a secret easter egg. I've said too much.
follow_up_negative: No worries. We'll keep you posted on the changelog.
Fair. Dev updates are usually just 'we moved a pixel.'
Got it. Let Sinewave cook.

responses: _VEN0M is our frontend wizard. If the UI feels smooth, that's them. If it's broken, that's also them. (Kidding, mostly.)
_VEN0M has been on a Tailwind kick lately. The CSS purists are worried.
Ask _VEN0M about the time they accidentally deployed a debug border on every div. We don't talk about it.
follow_up: Want to know which parts of the site _VEN0M built?
follow_up_affirmative: They did the entire tank comparison tool and the new search modal. Also responsible for making the sidebar not suck.
_VEN0M also coded the dark/light theme toggle. If your eyes aren't bleeding, thank them.
They're currently rewriting the asset gallery. Pray for their RAM.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Frontend work is invisible when it's good, anyway.
Fair. Just know they made this chat window look decent.

responses: Anuraen is our graphic designer. They make the ugly stuff we code look presentable.
Anuraen designed the new logo. The old one was just Comic Sans in a trench coat.
If the website looks good, that's Anuraen. If it looks bad, we didn't listen to Anuraen.
follow_up: Want to know what Anuraen is working on?
follow_up_affirmative: They're designing a full set of agent ability icons. No ETA, but the concept art is gorgeous.
Anuraen is also redoing the mobile layout. They keep yelling at Sinewave about viewport units.
Secret project: a physical HEAT Labs sticker pack. Anuraen is very particular about the Pantone colors.
follow_up_negative: All good. Design is one of those 'trust the process' things.

responses: esmatty writes the community guides and patch notes. If it sounds coherent, that's them.
esmatty once wrote a 3,000-word guide on how to play the M60A3E2. It's pinned in Discord for a reason.
Fun fact: esmatty is actually a bot. Just kidding. Probably.
follow_up: Want esmatty's most popular guide?
follow_up_affirmative: The 'How Not To Suck At Scarred City' guide. 15k views and counting.
They also wrote the 'Beginner's Guide to Agent Synergies'. Required reading for new players.
esmatty's hidden gem is the 'Mental Health for Tankers' post. It's surprisingly deep.
follow_up_negative: No worries. They're always writing something new.

responses: __Shockwave is a content writer, but he mostly just memes in the dev channel.
Shockwave's job title is 'Content Writer'. His actual job is keeping morale up with bad puns.
He wrote the April Fool's patch notes last year. We still get DMs about the 'Nerf Bat Mk. II'.
follow_up: Want a sample of Shockwave's writing?
follow_up_affirmative: "The E-100 has been removed from the game. Just kidding. But you should still flank it." - Shockwave, probably.
He also writes the 'Tank of the Week' features. His ELC Even 90 article is legendary.
His best work is the changelog entry that just said 'Made the tanks tankier. You're welcome.'
follow_up_negative: Fair. His humor is an acquired taste.

responses: IAmEdwards_ is our game analyst. If an agent feels balanced, blame him. If it feels broken, also blame him.
Edwards is the reason Blitz's EMP radius got nerfed. You're welcome.
He runs the internal playtests. Dude has 5,000 hours in HEAT. Touch grass, Edwards.
follow_up: Want to know what Edwards is analyzing right now?
follow_up_affirmative: He's crunching numbers on Reaper. Some folks think the execute threshold is too high.
Also looking at Anansi pick rates. The gunship might get a small duration buff.
Edwards is also tracking Hound's effectiveness in competitive play. Expect tweaks next patch.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Balance discussions are eternal anyway.

responses: antitank99 is the other half of our game analyst duo. He's the 'tank' to Edwards' 'gun'.
antitank specializes in armor profiles and weak spots. If you pens something weird, he knows why.
He once correctly predicted a meta shift three months in advance. We're pretty sure he's a wizard.
follow_up: Want a random tank fact from antitank99?
follow_up_affirmative: The M60A3E2's upper plate is autobounce at exactly 67 degrees. He knows this because he tried to pen it 400 times.
He hates the Object 907. Won't say why. Just makes a face.
antitank's favorite tank is the Leopard 1. 'No armor, best armor.'
follow_up_negative: Alright. He's got a million of them, so just ask later.

responses: We're hiring a Sound Library Curator! If you've got a good ear and love tank noises, hit us up.
The Sound Library Curator position is still open. Applicants must be able to distinguish between an L7 and an M68 by sound alone.
Sinewave is reviewing applications for the Sound Curator role. So far, three people have submitted memes. It's going well.
follow_up: Interested in applying for the Sound Curator role?
follow_up_affirmative: DM @sinewave on Discord with your experience. Bonus points if you can identify tank engines blindfolded.
Seriously, we need someone who can organize 2,000+ sound files. It's a mess in there.
The role is volunteer for now, but we send merch and Steam gift cards. Also eternal glory.
follow_up_negative: No problem. Know anyone who might be interested?

responses: We're also looking for a 3D Content Specialist. Polygons? Textures? That's the gig.
3D Specialist opening: must love tanks, know Blender, and tolerate Sinewave's terrible sketches.
The 3D role is still open. We have so many tank models to build. Please send help.
follow_up: Want to apply for the 3D Content Specialist role?
follow_up_affirmative: Shoot your portfolio to @sinewave on Discord. Show us your tanks. Or your rocks. We need both.
We're specifically looking for someone to model environment assets. Scarred City needs more rubble.
This is also a volunteer role, but you get early access to everything and your name in the credits.
follow_up_negative: Alright. We'll keep looking. Maybe Anuraen knows someone.

responses: Cazaira created the entire gun elevation and depression database. Every tank, every angle. Absolute legend.
Before Cazaira, we didn't know how far down the M60's gun could depress. Now we do. 10 degrees, by the way.
Cazaira spent 200 hours testing gun angles so you don't have to. o7
follow_up: Want to see Cazaira's handiwork?
follow_up_affirmative: Check the Tank Statistics page. Every single gun depression angle is credited to them.
They also found a bug where one tank had -15 degrees depression. It was immediately patched.
Cazaira is the reason we have a 'Hull Down Score' on each tank profile.
follow_up_negative: Alright. Just know that every ridgeline warrior owes them a debt.

responses: legocity2000 transcribed all the general voice lines for the Soundboard. That's thousands of 'Reloading!' and 'Enemy spotted!' clips.
They spent weeks with audio files and a text editor. True dedication.
If you've ever used the Soundboard, you've used legocity2000's work.
follow_up: Also a tester?
follow_up_affirmative: Yeah! They also helped test the Discord Activity. The man is everywhere.
legocity2000 found three critical bugs in the Soundboard beta. Absolute unit.
He's our most prolific tester and transcriber. We're not sure when he sleeps.
follow_up_negative: Still a legend for the transcription work alone.

responses: SirBarett transcribed all the German voice lines. Jawohl, Panzer vor!
German tank voices are his specialty. He knows the difference between a Tiger and a Panther just by the crew chatter.
SirBarett also corrected our grammar. Twice. Danke schön.
follow_up: How many German voice lines did SirBarett do?
follow_up_affirmative: Over 500 individual clips. Every nation-specific line for German tanks is his work.
He also recorded reference audio for some rare lines we couldn't find. The man has the voice of a panzer commander.
We owe him at least one beer. Or a schnitzel.
follow_up_negative: Alright. Just know the German Soundboard section is his masterpiece.

responses: I_Love_Lettuce transcribed the utility sound files. Alarms, beeps, explosions—the boring but essential stuff.
They did 400+ UI sound effects. Every click, every ping, every 'mission accomplished'.
Lettuce is a sound editing wizard. Also, they really love lettuce.
follow_up: What's the deal with the username?
follow_up_affirmative: We asked. They just said 'lettuce is crispy.' We didn't press further.
Their profile pic is a head of romaine. Commitment to the bit.
Honestly, respect. Lettuce is pretty good.
follow_up_negative: Fair. Some mysteries are best left unsolved.

responses: Pigeon_Pie contributed 123 replay files. That's over 20 hours of gameplay footage.
We used his replays to test armor models, shell penetration, and map collisions.
Dude has over 10,000 battles. He's seen some things.
follow_up: What did we learn from Pigeon_Pie's replays?
follow_up_affirmative: Found three map geometry bugs and a rare shell-trajectory glitch.
Also confirmed that the Object 907 is still bullshit. Thanks, Pigeon_Pie.
His replays are our primary source for testing weird edge cases. Incredibly valuable.
follow_up_negative: No problem. His replays speak for themselves.

responses: TechTanker dropped 116 replays on us. All high-tier, all competitive.
He specializes in tournament play. His replays are how we balance for the sweaty lobbies.
TechTanker also annotated most of them with timestamps. Above and beyond.
follow_up: What's TechTanker's favorite tank?
follow_up_affirmative: STB-1. No contest. Dude has 3,000 battles in it.
His replays taught us that the STB-1 is borderline OP in the right hands.
We might have to nerf it. Sorry, TechTanker.
follow_up_negative: Fair. Let's just say he's a medium tank enjoyer.

responses: dema_GG_UA submitted 103 replays. A true scholar of the game.
His replays focus heavily on map positioning. He's the reason we updated the Sunstroke guide.
dema also helped validate our spaced armor calculations. Huge help.
follow_up: Is dema_GG_UA Ukrainian?
follow_up_affirmative: Yeah, the UA tag is a giveaway. Proud representation in the HEAT community.
He submitted replays during some tough times. We're honored he took the time to help us.
We donated to a Ukrainian charity in his name. o7
follow_up_negative: Didn't mean to assume. Just know we appreciate him.

responses: Calisota contributed 17 replays. Not the most, but quality over quantity.
His replays are all light tank gameplay. Dude is a spotting god.
We used his footage to rework the view range mechanics page.
follow_up: What makes Calisota's replays special?
follow_up_affirmative: He plays the ELC Even 90 like a possessed goblin. It's art.
His passive spotting positions are insane. He finds bushes we didn't even know existed.
We added three new spotting locations to the map guides because of him.
follow_up_negative: No worries. Light tank mains are a different breed.

responses: SenorRagequit only sent 2 replays, but they were both bangers.
Also helped test the HEAT Labs Android App. Found a critical memory leak.
The name is ironic. Dude has incredible patience.
follow_up: What did SenorRagequit find in the Android app?
follow_up_affirmative: A crash bug when viewing tank models with 4GB RAM devices. Fixed before launch.
Also suggested the 'night mode' toggle. That was all him.
He's the reason the app doesn't melt your phone. Genuine hero.
follow_up_negative: Alright. Just know he punched way above his weight with those 2 replays.

responses: Got it. Anything else you want to know?
Cool. Let me know if you need more details.
Alright. I've got plenty more tips if you need them.
Copy that. What's next?
Roger roger. Like the battle droids say.
Understood. Ask away if something else comes up.
Good deal. I'm here when you need me.
Perfect. Want to switch topics?
Alrighty then. What else is on your mind?
Gotcha covered. Next question?
follow_up: Was that helpful or do you want something different?
follow_up_affirmative: Awesome! Glad I could help.
Great! That's what I'm here for.
Perfect. Let me know if you need anything else.
follow_up_negative: Oh, not what you needed? Try asking more specifically.
Sorry about that. Want to try a different agent or map?
Darn. I'm better with agents and maps—ask me about those.

responses: Right? I thought so too.
Glad you like it. The devs wrote that one.
Thanks! I'm just the messenger.
Yeah, it's a solid tip. Works every time.
I know, right? These agents are wild.
Appreciate that. o7
Nice. You want another one?
Sweet. That's the stuff.
follow_up: Want another tip on the same topic, or switch to something else?
follow_up_affirmative: Sure thing! Here's another one...
You got it. Let me think of another good one...
Absolutely. Stay on this topic?
follow_up_negative: No problem. What do you want to ask about next?
Cool. Just let me know when you're ready.
Alright. I'll be here.

responses: Hey there! Ask me about Agents, maps, or the dev team.
Hello! What can I help you with today?
Hi! I'm HEAT Labs AI. Need tips on an agent or map?
Hey! No LLMs were used in the making of this greeting.
Yo. Ready to learn some tank stuff?
Sup. I've got intel on Blitz, Hound, Raketa—you name it.
Howdy, partner. Saddle up and ask me something.
Greetings, human. I come in peace. Mostly.
follow_up: Need help with something specific? Try asking about Blitz, Hound, or Scarred City.
follow_up_affirmative: Great! What would you like to know? Agents, maps, dev gossip, or community legends?
I'm listening. Ask me about specific agents, map strategies, or even the dev team.
Shoot! I've got intel on pretty much everything HEAT-related.
follow_up_negative: No problem. I'll be here when you need me.
Alright. Just type whenever you have a question.
Cool. I'll just be here, waiting for the next prompt.

responses: You're welcome. (No LLMs were harmed.)
Anytime. That's what I'm here for.
Glad I could help. Ask me anything else!
o7 Happy to help.
No problem. That's my job.
Anytime, commander.
You got it. Come back anytime.
My pleasure. Seriously, I enjoy this.
Don't mention it. Well, you already did, but you know what I mean.
follow_up: Was that helpful? Anything else you need?

responses: Not sure about that one. Try asking about Agents, Maps, or the dev team.

follow_up: Want me to explain how my AI works?
follow_up_affirmative: I'm a rule-based system, not an LLM. Every response is pre-written and matched to keywords in your message. No neural networks, no training data—just JSON and JavaScript. The devs update the database manually when they add new agents or maps.
The typing effect is pure front-end. Every word gets streamed character by character to look more natural. The responses themselves? All handcrafted by humans who play the game.
Think of me as an interactive FAQ with a personality. I can't learn from our conversations, but I can point you to every tip the devs have written. It's less AI, more IA—Intelligent Assistant.
follow_up_negative: No problem. The magic is better than the mechanics.

responses: I'm just a JSON file with a typing effect. Take it up with the devs.
